item.title: Apple releases sample apps tutorials for Swift Playgrounds and Xcode
item.description: Apple has dropped ten (10) sample apps tutorials for newly released Playgrounds 4 and Xcode. ‘Sample Apps Tutorials’ page lists 4 chapters containing multiple apps to showcase different techniques to users like navigating between pages, fetching content from servers, handling user input and more. On every sample app’s page, you will find project’s summary, a button to download project files, and step by step explanation of code. To follow the tutorials you will need Swift Playgrounds 4 or later on your iPad, and Xcode 13.

item.title: Swift Playgrounds 4 released for iPad and Mac
item.description: Yes, the wait is finally over now. Apple just dropped the long awaited update for Swift Playgrounds, you can download the latest version from App Store (download links at bottom). It brings the ability to develop iPhone and iPad apps right from any iPad running iPadOS 15.2 or later. So if your iPad got the iPadOS 15 update, you are in for the treat. However for the Mac app, story is different, it just adds support for Swift 5.

item.title: Swift Playgrounds 4: Things we know so far
item.description: During WWDC 2021 keynote Craig Fedrighi teased Playgrounds 4 for iPad by saying that it will bring the ability to “build apps on iPad”. Later that day we saw a short demo of the new Playgrounds during “Platforms State of the Union”, a developer centric keynote that dives deeper into the newly announced tools and technologies. Since that day we haven’t heard anything more about the Playgrounds 4 update.
